block.p: Gayle Michelle Farbman and Michael David Wasserman were married last evening at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, N.Y. Rabbi Paula Winnig of Temple Sinai of Long Island in Lawrence, N.Y., officiated.

The bride and bridegroom are graduates of the New York University School of Law, where they met. Mr. Wasserman received his J.D. cum laude and his bachelor's degree, also from New York University, magna cum laude.

Gayle Michelle Farbman and Michael David Wasserman were married last evening at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, N.Y. Rabbi Paula Winnig of Temple Sinai of Long Island in Lawrence, N.Y., officiated.

The bride and bridegroom are graduates of the New York University School of Law, where they met. Mr. Wasserman received his J.D. cum laude and his bachelor's degree, also from New York University, magna cum laude.

Mrs. Wasserman, 25, is an associate in the labor and employment department at Proskauer Rose, the New York law firm. She received a B.A. from the University of Michigan. The bride is the daughter of Fran and David Farbman of Lawrence.

Mr. Wasserman, 27, is a staff attorney in the enforcement division at the United States Securities and Exchange Commission in New York. He is the son of Burton and Norma Wasserman of New Rochelle, N.Y.
